unnormalised: Someone asked me what all these different IDs are for, especially in the Indian context. Bhai, it's like trying to keep track of all the relatives at an Indian wedding – overwhelming! You’ve got your PAN card, which is like your financial DNA – everyone needs one, like it or not! Then there's your GSTIN, because apparently, taxing things once wasn’t enough, now we have GST as well. It's like having to pay rent to two landlords instead of one. Seriously, who came up with this stuff?
normalised: Someone asked me what all these different I-Ds are for, especially in the Indian context. Bhai, it's like trying to keep track of all the relatives at an Indian wedding – overwhelming! You’ve got your P-A-N card, which is like your financial D-N-A – everyone needs one, like it or not! Then there's your G-S-T-I-N, because apparently, taxing things once wasn’t enough, now we have G-S-T as well. It's like having to pay rent to two landlords instead of one. Seriously, who came up with this stuff?

unnormalised: And don’t forget your TAN! It's for tax deducted at source...as if you’re not already suffering enough from taxes! It’s kinda like they're saying, "We're taking your money, but we'll give you a special ID for it, so you feel better". It’s almost as if they expect us to frame it and put it on the wall! Some companies also have a CIN number, which sounds like a spy movie, but it is really just an identifier. Imagine having to rattle all this off every time you pay someone.

unnormalised: Honestly, sometimes I think the govt just makes these things up to keep us on our toes. Between your PAN no. like ABCDE1234F and your GSTIN 06AAACC1234A1Z0 you end up feeling like a walking, talking barcode. But hey, at least you're identifiable, right? Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to go file some forms...with all those IDs, of course! Wish me luck. It is going to be worse than trying to untangle maggi noodles.
